abstract: The Dutch bank ABN Amro, the subject of one of the largest takeover battles in history, said Monday it had rejected a $24.5 billion offer for its Lasalle Bank subisidiary from a group including the Royal Bank of Scotland, finding it “did not constitute a superior proposal” to a previous bid from Bank of America. Nevertheless, ABN said it would allow shareholders to vote on the competing bid and others, as required by last week’s ruling in an Amsterdam court.
lead_paragraph: The Dutch bank ABN Amro, the subject of one of the largest takeover battles in history, said Monday it had rejected a $24.5 billion offer for its Lasalle Bank subisidiary from a group including the Royal Bank of Scotland, finding it “did not constitute a superior proposal” to a previous bid from Bank of America. Nevertheless, ABN said it would allow shareholders to vote on the competing bid and others, as required by last week’s ruling in an Amsterdam court.

headline.main: ABN Amro Rejects $24.5 Billion Bid for Lasalle Bank
